meanings.sent1: He was humbugging his friend by pretending to have found a rare coin.
meanings.sent2: The con artist was humbugging unsuspecting tourists with his fake jewelry.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy enjoyed humbugging his sister by hiding her toys.
meanings.sent4: The magician humbugged the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent5: The sly fox was humbugging the chickens into following him with promises of treats.

meanings.definition: Pretending to be something one is not
meanings.sent1: The humbugging salesman claimed his products were made of gold.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his humbugging smile and knew he was not sincere.
meanings.sent3: The humbugging actor tried to pass off his fake accent as authentic.
meanings.sent4: The humbugging prince disguised himself as a commoner to explore the city.
meanings.sent5: Her humbugging behavior at the party fooled no one.

meanings.definition: Engaging in dishonest or deceitful behavior
meanings.sent1: The humbugging politician promised lower taxes but raised them instead.
meanings.sent2: The humbugging merchant sold counterfeit goods to unsuspecting customers.
meanings.sent3: The humbugging student copied his friend's homework and got caught.
meanings.sent4: The humbugging businessman manipulated the stock market for personal gain.
meanings.sent5: The humbugging scheme was uncovered by vigilant investigators.
